SENT.plain: A 59-year-old woman admitted to hospital in coma also showed generalized muscular rigidity and porphyria
After two days she became fully conscious but the muscular rigidity increased and persisted until death occurred 12 weeks later
The brain showed diffuse degeneration of the white matter; symmetrical necrosis of the globus pallidus was associated with severe localized atherosclerosis
The lesions probably resulted from the combined effects of porphyria and atherosclerosis
It is suggested that in later life unusual cerebral lesions may occur with porphyria because of associated atherosclerosis
The porphyria may be overlooked clinically
